comments.body: Because `state` isn't defined in `aci_argument_spec`, should not this done in `aci_tenant.py` ? I mean, `ACIModule` could be subclassed in `aci_tenant.py` and `define_method` could be overridden here.

I don't think we need that complexity. Fact is that all modules will be using `state` except aci_rest which will be using `method`. So we only care about deprecating `method` if the module accepts `state`.

PS Yes, aci_tenant should not have been merged, it was not ready to be merged. A lot is going on at: https://github.com/datacenter/aci-ansible/pulls which supersedes aci_tenant. (aci_rest however is feature-complete)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +139,143 @@        if self.params['method']:
            # Deprecate only if state was a valid option (not for aci_rest)
            if self.module.argument_spec('state', False):
                self.module.deprecate("Parameter 'method' or 'action' is deprecated, please use 'state' instead", '2.6')
            method_map = dict(delete='absent', get='query', post='present')
